comments.body: Any update ? more than 3 years now
It's been 2 years and this issue is still requested, are there plans to support this in the future?

Edge is currently the only mainstream browser that has not implemented this.
Unfortunately the :placeholder-shown pseudo-class is the only way to work around the fact that there is no :empty state for input elements without falling back to javascript.
:placeholder-shown is thus tremendously helpful when adding any non-trivial styles to input elements for dynamic form-validation etc.
It's not a hard feature to implement.
Without this pseuso-class we are forced to recreate inputs using custom elements which is overkill just to get a little more control over the styling.
Please Microsoft!
With this feature we can validate form via css
Internet explorer partially supports it, how could edge be behind ie on this feature?
